hypothesis: Higher sigma early for exploration, lower sigma late for convergence.
conclusion: ABORTED - Prior evidence shows this approach will fail
rationale_for_abort: EXP_TEMPORAL_HIGHER_SIGMA_001 FAILED: Sigma 0.25/0.30 achieves better accuracy (1.1745) but takes 63 min (over budget). Best in-budget with high sigma was 1.1584 @ 52 min, WORSE than W2 baseline (1.1688).
EXP_ADAPTIVE_TIMESTEP_001 FAILED: Changing conditions mid-run disrupts CMA-ES covariance adaptation.
CMA-ES ALREADY adapts sigma naturally during optimization.
The fundamental tradeoff: high sigma = better exploration = more time. No scheduling can bypass this.
Time is better spent on other experiments than testing known-to-fail approaches.
key_finding: Sigma adaptation is already optimal in CMA-ES. Manual scheduling cannot improve on the algorithm's natural adaptation without adding time.
